visualization_explanation: The dataset comprises six categorical series representing atmospheric layers, each with a single quantitative value normalized for percentage stacking. Synthetic height ranges and informational annotations were constructed using NASA's atmospheric stratification model, maintaining proportional accuracy through equal segment distribution. The monochromatic color gradient follows atmospheric density changes while ensuring accessibility. The 100% stacked column format maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant axes, directly encoding layer proportions through segment widths. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through sequential color saturation (higher layers = lighter hues) and immediate tooltip information access. Equal value distribution (μ=1, σ=0) creates conceptual rather than mathematical proportionality, prioritizing educational clarity over precise measurement representation.
